STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 23, 2025
Darnell Britt
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann St.
Detroit, MI, 48205-2748
Re: License #: CB820315857
SI #: 2025SIC0000899
Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the please contact the WOC area manager, Shay Mavis, at
269-243-2725.
Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***Report Contains Quoted Profanity***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000899
Special Investigation Intake Date: July 30, 2025
License #: CB820315857
Licensee Group Organization: Community Care Organization
Licensee Designee: Kendra Washington
Chief Administrator: Darnell Britt
Agency Name: COMMUNITY CARE ORGANIZATION
Agency Address: 18688 JOANN ST
DETROIT, MI 48205-2748
License Status: 1st Provisional
License Expiration Date: 02/17/2026

8/28/2025 10:40 AM Phone Interview

9/4/2025 11:10 AM Phone Interview
9/18/2025 10:02 AM Documentation MDHHS Worker – No Findings
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Staff 1 an IL staff person failed to intervene and
protect Youth A from other youths who were assaulting Youth A.
Investigation Interviews:
On 8/4/2025 Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS)
Worker and I interviewed Youth A on the porch at her current
Lakewood Independent living (IL) placement. Youth A reported
engaging in a physical altercation with other youths on two
occasion on the same day one day last week. Youth A did not
recall the exact day of the incident. She described the chain of
events that day. She reported that the first incident occurred
earlier in the day, while at a school location where she and other
IL youths were assigned to work, but no staff were present. She
reported having a bruise on her face and the back of her neck
from that incident, but stated those marks are gone now. She
denied the police being called about that altercation or her
showing the bruise to the Program Director (PD), or another staff;
nor that the PD asked her about the fight at the school.
Youth A reported once she and the other youths were back at the
IL house, Youth B came to her room upset over something, called
2

her a bitch and left. Youth A said she followed Youth B
downstairs. She reported Staff 1, who was the staff on shift at the
time, told her, Youth B and Youth C to let their feelings about what
had transpired between them earlier go. Staff 1 told them if they
started fighting she was not going to break it up. Additionally,
Staff 1 told Youth A that Youth A had been attacking everyone
verbally. Youth A reported not knowing what Staff 1 meant by that
remark. She asked Staff 1 to explain, but Youth D responded
instead. Youth D told her that she had been disrespectful to the
staff; “was always starting shit”; and Youth D “stepped to me”.
Youth A said she pushed Youth D back and the two of them
started fighting. Youth A said Youth C jumped into the fight by
grabbing her; and Youth C and Youth D were tag teaming her in
the fight. Youth A said Youth D also threatened that if Youth A did
not let her go, Youth D would punch her. She said Youth C got her
in a choke hold, while they were on the floor, but she was able to
get free; and she got up from the floor. Youth A reported thereon,
Youth C and Youth D went into Youth D’s room. Youth A reported
going to Youth D’s door, banging on it, trying to get in because
she was still upset. She said Staff 1 was still present in the home.
Staff 1 told her to get away from Youth D’s door. Youth A
reported that Staff 1 stated, “She must want her ass kicked again”,
referring to Youth A. Youth A reported Youth C and Youth D
grabbed her and were punching her again. They got her to the
floor; but she was able to kick them. She also threw a mop head
as Youth D was going out the door; but Youth D made it out the
door. She tried also to grab someone’s purse to throw but Youth
E told her not to threw it. Youth A did not report where Youth E
had been previously; as Youth’s A reporting on the chain of
actions happening was not consistently cohesive. As Youth A
also reported being put in a choke hold by Youth E and that they
were outside. It was not clear from Youth A’s statement when they
got outside and whether the choke hold happened inside or
outside. Youth A did not state where Staff 1 was during this
incident.
Youth A reported she was able to hit Youth E with a stick, but
Youth E was able to get the stick and was hitting her with it. While
this incident was happening with Youth E, Youth A said Youth C
and Youth D were sitting on the porch cheering Youth E on calling
Youth E the “Queen” and telling Youth E to get her. Youth A
reported at some point she saw a cop and the cop tackled her and
Youth E, but during that process she pulled Youth E’s hair. She
said Staff 1 also reported Youth E was pregnant and so Youth E
yelled “If you kill my baby, I’m going to kill you”. Youth A reported
that the police put her in the car and initially told her they were
3

going to charge her. Youth A believed that was because Youth C,
Youth D had reported things in Youth E’s favor and because
Youth E is pregnant.
Youth A reported that the police took her to the hospital, but she
was later released to the Community Care Organization staff. She
said she was moved from the Lansdowne IL home where the fight
occurred. She was placed at the agency’s Lakewood IL home. As
to how the police got on the scene, Youth A said Staff 1 had told
them if they fought she would not break it up; she would call the
police. But Youth A stated she believes the neighbor called the
police.
On 8/13/2025, I interviewed Youth B with DHHS Worker at
Lansdown’s IL home. Youth B acknowledged that she and Youth
A got into a physical altercation at a landscaping job they were at
earlier in the day a couple of weeks ago. She said no police were
involved and no staff were present. She did not have any bruises
from the incident. She was not sure whether Youth A had any
marks or bruises. She said when they got back to the Lansdown
IL home Staff 1 told them to let go of what had happened earlier;
to not make it worst by bringing that situation back up.
Youth B said she did not see how the fight started with Youth A
and Youth E, because she had gone to the store. She said when
she returned she saw Youth A and Youth E on the ground across
the street from the IL home. The fight had ended, and the police
was present. Youth B reported with respect to the physical
incident that had occurred in the house earlier, Staff 1 did not
encourage she and Youth C to fight Youth A, and told them to
stop fighting. As to who called the police that day, Youth B was
not certain. She thought it may have been Staff 2 because before
Youth B left for the store, she saw Youth A push Staff 1 into a
wall. Though Youth B did not report Staff 2 being the staff on shift.
On 8/13/2025 DHHS Worker and I interviewed Neighbor Man
(NM) outside his home. NM’s home is across the street from the
Lansdown IL house, and he was listed in the police report as a
witness. NM acknowledged witnessing a fight between two
youths. He reported the Big Girl” (whom we determined to be
Youth E) kept telling the “Little Girl” (whom we determined to be
Youth A) to leave and to stop. NM described Youth A as the
aggressor. NM reported that Youth A picked up a stick and was
hitting Youth E with it while Youth E kept telling Youth A to stop
and to go. Then Youth E got the stick from Youth A and was
hitting Youth A with it. NM said when the police arrived, they put
4

handcuffs on Youth A. NM was asked whether he observed a staff
person at the IL home on the scene. NM reported observing a
woman whom he surmised was the staff person. He said, “she
was standing around; she looked like she was scared”. NM said
the staff person was not doing anything. He did not observe the
staff to encourage or push the two youths to fight.
On 8/20/2025 during a telephone call with DHHS Worker, she
reported having a telephone contact with Youth E whom we had
tried to contact on 8/13/2025. She reported that Youth E had
confirmed information reported by Youth A related to Youth A
picking up a purse and throwing it. Youth E reported the purse
was hers and she had told Youth A not to throw it, but Youth A
ignored her. Youth E reported after Youth A ignored her about
throwing the purse, they had a physical altercation. Youth E
reported putting Youth A in a headlock and dragging Youth A
outside; and the two of them fighting outside. DHHS Worker said
Youth E reported Staff 1 was not outside when she and Youth A
were fighting. Additionally, DHHS Worker said Youth E told her
when Youth A, Youth C and Youth D were involved in the physical
altercation inside the IL house, Staff 1 was telling them to stop;
and so was Youth E.
On 8/25/2025 I interviewed Youth E by telephone. She reported
not being present for the incident between Youth A, and other
youths at the job site. She confirmed information as reported by
DHHS Worker. She clarified as it pertained to the fight between
Youth A and other youths at the house, Case Manager had called
Staff 1 while she was in the car with Staff 1 to say the girls were
arguing and fighting. Case Manager reported she needed to
leave; that she was “too old for this shit”. Youth E reported Youth
A had been arguing or trying to start stuff with different girls all
day. Youth E said when Youth A and Youth D began to fight,
Youth C jumped in. Youth E said Staff 1 was telling them not to
fight, and to stop fighting. Youth E said Staff 1 also tried to help
her break up the fight, because Youth C and Youth D were
beating up Youth A. She said Staff 1 trying to break up the fight is
how Staff 1 broke her nail. Youth E reported then Youth C, Youth
D and Youth A went into a bedroom and Youth C and Youth D
were beating Youth A up again. Youth E reported she and Staff 1
got the girls separated again. She reported that after the latter
event, they went into the living room and that’s when Youth A
grabbed her purse and threw it at her. Youth E said she put Youth
A into a headlock and took Youth A outside. While outside Youth
A picked up a stick and hit her with it. Youth E said she really did
not want to fight Youth A, that she was telling Youth A to stop, but
5

Youth A would not. Youth E reported while in the house Staff 1
was trying to deescalate the situation. She said Staff 1 called the
police when they were in the living room, but it took a long while
for the police to get there. Youth E was not sure what more Staff 1
could have done.
On 8/25/2025 I interviewed Program Director (PD) with DHHS
Worker at the agency’s office in Eastpointe Michigan. PD
reported the incident occurred on 7/28/2025. She reported it was
what was told to her by youths, but more actually what she saw on
video of the incident led her to self-report the complaint. She said
she saw Staff 1 moving furniture out of the way when the youths
were fighting, and Staff 1 was not trying to de-escalate the
situation. Nor was Staff 1 seen quickly calling the police. PD
reported the agency’s protocol related to this type of physical
incident is staff will not try to break up a fight but will immediately
call the police; and will send a special text code in the staff group
chat, (the special code, is meant for staff to come the house)
group chat. PD reported Staff 1 had sent a text that afternoon,
indicating Doctor Brown (the code) but then replied back that it
was a typo. Staff 1 never called or texted to say there was a
problem at the house, that the girls were fighting or that Staff 1
needed assistance. PD reported Staff 1 was suspended pending
the departmental investigation, but at this point, she does not
foresee the agency reinstating Staff 1. PD provided DHHS
Worker and I a copy of the videos she had.
On 8/25/2025, I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency’s Eastpointe,
Michigan office, with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported employment
with the agency as a Youth Advocate since July 2025. Her work
shift is 3:00PM-11:00PM. She reported receiving training on the
agency’s behavior policy/how to handle incidents such as physical
fighting and the safety protocol. She reported if youths are
fighting the staff are to call 911, and to do a group text denoting
“Call Doctor Brown”, which would let other staff know there is an
emergency situation.
Staff 1 reported the day of the alleged incident, the girls (at this
time she did not qualify who those girls were), had got into a fight
prior to her shift. She reported receiving a call from Youth
Advocate Supervisor prior to the start of her shift telling her to get
to the IL house because the girls had been fighting. Staff 1
reported that when she arrived at the IL house, Case Manager
was there talking with the girls about fighting. Staff 1 reported
after that, and even an hour later, all the girls were okay with one
another. She reported that day was also check day, and she,
6

Staff 3 and Case Manager where onsite. Staff 3 and Case
Manager were handing out checks; and later she and Case
Manager took the girls out to cash their check and to grocery
shop. She advised Youth A did not receive a check and Youth A
was upset about that. She added prior to her and Case Manager
taking the girls out, an incident occurred between Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C. She stated Youth A and Youth B argued over a
pen and then all three of the youths were arguing. Staff 1 reported
she believed that tension may have existed between the youths,
because she had learned that earlier in the day Youth B and
Youth C had attacked Youth A. Staff 1 reported that she and
Case Manager deescalated the tension/arguing between these
three youth and then separated the youths to take them to cash
checks. Staff 1 reported having Youth B, Youth C, Youth E and a
youth (whom she did not identify) from the Lakewood IL home in
her vehicle. She reported while out shopping at the beauty store,
Youth B and Youth C separated from her group. She sought to
find them and when back to the Lansdown IL house. She said
while she was in route to the IL house, Case Manager called her
via Youth E’s phone (she did not clarify why the contact occurred
that way) and reported the girls (she did not identify which girls) at
the house were fighting again. Case Manager told her, “I’m too
old for this”; and upon Staff 1’s arrival at the IL house, Case
Manager “left promptly, and left [Staff 1] alone”. Staff 1 said when
she got inside the house, Youth A and Youth C were ready to
throw blows. She said as a staff they are not to put hands on the
girls, so she tried to calm Youth A down. Staff 1 reported Youth B
was not at the house; it was Youth A and Youth C having words
over what had transpired between the two of them earlier. Staff 1
said she and Youth E were trying to de-escalate Youth A and
Youth C. She said Youth C asked Youth A whether Youth A
wanted to fight; and when Youth A said yes, the two started
fighting. Staff 1 reported because the two youth were fighting she
was not to touch them. She said she moved the table and a chair
out the way, for her safety. She said that was because the girls
had already fought, and she was not going to get hit with a table
or chair.
She said there was so much happening that day. She said the
first was with Youth A and Youth C. The second was with Youth A
and Youth D and that Youth C jumped into. Staff 1 reported the
latter fight “was a bad fight”, the girls were on the floor, pulling
each other. She said she did try to pull them apart at the time.
Then after that she told Youth A to reflect on the situation and to
chill, and Youth A pushed her.
7

Staff 1 reported she called 911, but she was not sure when that
was. She thought it was after the second fight in the house; and
before the incident in the bedroom, when Youth A tried to go into a
bedroom after Youth C and Youth D. Staff 1 admitted she did not
call the police as fast as she should have. She stated “that’s
where I messed up. I should have called the police, after the first
fight.” She stated, “but I was trying to de-escalate” Youth A. She
said Youth A was not listening to anything she said. She said she
could not de-escalate Youth A. She did not report what if anything
she did to try to calm or de-escalate the other youths. Staff 1 also
reported that she texted the “Code Brown” in the group chat at
about 7:42PM after the second fight between the youths. She
reported she did not retract that text; she said someone
responded back what is Code Brown. She did not report in the
chat she needed help. She said she had also called Youth
Advocate Supervisor five times that day indicating the girls were
trying to fight. Staff 1 did not report on the incident with Youth E
and Youth A outside. Staff 1 denied making a statement to Youth
A or others that “she wants to get her ass kicked again”.
On 8/25/2025, I interviewed Youth D at the agency’s Eastpointe,
Michigan office with DHHS Worker. Youth D said after they all
returned from grocery shopping, Youth A and Youth C argued.
Youth A asked Youth C whether Youth C wanted to fight. Youth D
said as Youth A and Youth C were arguing she was telling the two
of them to calm down. She said she was in the middle of them;
and Youth A asked Youth D whether she was talking to her. Youth
D reported then Youth A got in her face, so she put down her
food, took off her glasses and Youth A hit her and the two of them
started fighting. Youth D said Staff 1 was telling them to stop and
then Youth E started recording the fight. Youth D said then she
and Youth C went into her bedroom, and she held the door
closed, while Youth A tried to get inside. Youth D reported Staff 1
and Youth E were telling Youth A to calm down while Youth A was
telling Youth D and Youth C to open the bedroom door and calling
them bitches. Youth D said she let go of the door; and Youth A
entered the bedroom and started fighting Youth C. Youth said
after Youth A stopped attacking Youth C, Youth A attacked her
and they were fighting. Youth D reported while she and Youth C
were in the bedroom, she heard Staff 1 calling whom she
assumed was the police or PD. She assumed that because she
heard Staff 1 describing what was happening with the fighting.
Youth D further reported something happened to Staff 1 when
Youth D and Youth C was in the bedroom. Youth D stated Staff 1
got hit with a chair or something, though Youth D did not report
actually seeing that. Youth D reported after her fight with Youth A,
8

Youth A threw Youth E’s purse at Youth E. Youth E head locked
Youth A and took Youth A outside. Youth D stated that’s how the
fight outside happened, and eight police and one fire truck came.
Youth D affirmed Case Manager had been on site earlier that day
but clarified for us Case Manager is not a youth site worker.
On 8/25/2025, I interviewed Youth C at the agency’s Eastpointe,
Michigan office with DHHS Worker. Youth C reported information
similar to Youth B, Youth E and Youth D related to events that had
transpired the day of the incident, and related to all of their
interactions, and fighting with Youth A. Youth C reported when
they were all fighting in the house Staff 1 was trying to calm
everything down, by telling them to calm down, to stop, but there
was not much Staff 1 could do with teenagers. Youth C reported
she would not say Staff 1 encouraged them to fight, but Staff 1 let
the fights happen. Youth C said once Staff 1 broke Staff 1’s nail,
which Youth C admit she did not see take place, Staff 1 just let the
other fighting happen. Youth C said Staff 1 definitively watched
part of the fighting play out before Staff 1 called the police. Youth
C reported that when the first fight with her and Youth A occurred
Staff 1 should have separated them, by telling her to go to one
area and Youth A to another, but Staff 1 did not do that. Youth C
denied witnessing Staff 1 moving furniture during the fighting; and
she was not sure if Staff 1 was recording the incidents, but
reported Staff 1 may have been.
On 8/28/2025 DHHS Worker and I spoke with Juvenile Justice
Worker (JJW), the JJ Worker for Youth A. JJW reported getting
notification about the incident about Youth A from the Community
Care Organization (CCO). She reported being new to Youth A’s
case and not being aware of any other incidents for Youth A at
CCO prior to this incident.
On 9/4/2025 I interviewed Youth Advocate Supervisor (YAS) by
telephone. YAS affirmed PD’s reporting as to the protocol for
emergencies related to calling the police, and the Doctor Brown
code in a group text if there is an assault. YAS denied Staff 1
calling her five times about the youths fighting. She said she had
chipped in that day and worked the 7:00AM-3:00PM shift prior to
Staff 1’s shift. She said the youths were all getting along fine
during that time. She reported at about 3:08PM she received a
call from Staff 4 and another call later from HR (Human
Resources) that there had been a fight at the work site; and the
girls could not come back. She said Case Manager went over to
the IL house to talk with the girls about them fighting on the
worksite between 3:30PM-5:00PM. YAS denied any awareness
9

of Case Manager reporting there was fight or Case Manager
saying something to the affect she was too old to deal with such
shit. She reported Staff 1 and Case Manager should have been
with the girls together. She admitted to seeing a text message in
the agency’s group chat from Staff 1 about something, but Staff 1
said it was a typo. YAS said Staff 1 never called or texted to say
the girls were fighting or that she needed assistance like she
should have. YAS reported becoming aware of the girls fighting
outside from Staff 5 (a worker from another nearby CCO’s IL
homes). Staff 5 had seen the typo text from Staff 1 and had gone
over to the Lansdown IL house at which time Staff 5 and called
YAS. YAS reported that when she arrived at Lansdown IL house
the fighting was over, the police were there, and Youth A was in
the ambulance. YAS said she called Case Manager to come back
onsite to go to the hospital with Youth A. YAS said Case Manager
seemed surprised to learn about the fight. She also reported that
Youth A was transferred from the Lansdown IL home to the
Lakewood IL home.
On 9/4/2025 I interviewed Case Manager (CM) by telephone. CM
recalled going to the Lansdown IL home to talk with the girls about
a fight some of the youths had at their work site. She reported the
discussion was between 1:00PM and 2:00PM. She said she
stayed onsite until Staff 1 arrived. She said the girls were not
physically fighting while she was there, but they were in a verbal
confrontation. Youth A and Youth D were calling each other the
“B” word, and she advised them if they got into a physical fight,
she would call the police. She affirmed reports by Staff 1 that they
separated the girls to take them to cash checks and shopping.
She denied the girls were fighting when she was onsite, or that
she called anyone to say the girls were fighting or that she said
she was too old for this shit. She said she became aware of a fight
between the youths when PD or YAS called her to come back
onsite, which was well after 5:00PM.
Video footage reviewed:
• A scene in the living room with Youth A, Youth E, Youth D
along with Staff 1. Youth A appeared to be talking and
waving her hands, putting them on her hip, taking off her
shoes, and the other youths appeared to be listening to her,
then they walked off and she followed. Staff 1 walked
around as well.
• A scene in the dining room where Youth A, Youth E, Youth
C and Youth D are standing near a dining room table. Staff
1 came in from the kitchen and appeared to be talking to
Youth A, while Youth C moved to the kitchen doorway.
10

Youth A gestured with both of her hands, bringing them up
them down.
• Youth D placed her plate of food on the table, took off her
glasses and stepped toward Youth A and Youth A attacked
Youth D. The two began fighting and Youth C immediately
jumped into the fight. At one point the three youths are up
against a wall, they struggled about, go up toward and on
the table and then onto the floor. Youth C and Youth D
threw numerous punches onto Youth A, and they have
Youth A on the floor, and are beating her up.
• Staff 1 left the room at one point and reentered. Staff 1
also pushed the table away at one point and stood on the
opposite side of table watching the youth beat each other
up.
• At one point Staff 1 was observed to briefly try to pull one
youth off Youth A, but at no point in this video was Staff 1
seen on her phone calling anyone. Nor did she appear to
put forth efforts to try to deescalate the situation.
• There was a point in the video footage where Youth E was
seen pulling or dragging Youth A on the floor and up, after
Youth C and Youth D had moved off Youth A.
• Youth C was also seen near the end of the fight running
into kitchen, obtaining a mop and hitting Youth A with it.
• Staff 1 walked about between the dining room and kitchen.
Document Review:
Copy of the Detroit Police report dated 7/30/2025:
• The police was dispatched on 7/28/2025 at 7:50PM to the
Lansdown address related to an assault and battery
incident.
• [Youth E] and [Youth A] were initially held at the site, and
[Youth E] was released.
• Documented [Youth E] and [Youth D] as the victims. And
that [Youth D] was observed to have cuts to her arm, and a
cut to her right foot.
• Documented [Staff 1] as the reporting person; and [NM] as
a witness.
• Documented [Youth A] as the offender; and the police
initially indicated based on the incident [Youth A]’s
probation was going to be violated; and she would be
transported to JDF (Juvenile Detention Facility). However,
after the officer spoke with someone about the dispatch,
they reported that [Youth A] could be released to [Case
Manager], who was documented as an involved other.
11

A Community Care Organization Incident report:
• Was dated 7/28/2025 for 3:06 PM lists several incidents
and happenings that day, inclusive of the incident with
Youth A and Youth E outside the IL home premises. Staff 1
reported she did not know how Youth E got Youth A
outside.
• Was completed by Staff 1 and she indicated: that Youth E
was not the aggressor. That Youth E had been trying to
help her to break up the fights with the girls; and Youth A
had been trying to fight others all day. She indicated Youth
A was upset and no one could stop her from fighting all
day. Staff 1 reported not knowing what was happening
inside the house once she stepped outside to call the
police. She indicated Youth E managed to restrain Youth A
via a choke hold and got Youth A outside; but. Staff 1 did
not indicate witnessing the choke hold or Youth E getting
Youth A outside. She indicated she never told Youth E to
get Youth A out the house. She further indicated that once
Youth A was outside Youth A had a physical altercation
with Youth E. She indicated Youth A was the first to pick up
a stick and Youth A tried to fight Youth E. She indicated
Youth E did not want to fight, but Youth A would not listen
to anyone telling her to stop; and even the police had a
hard time restraining Youth A.
• Mentioned PD being onsite when Staff 1 arrived for her
shift, and who was speaking with Youth A about another
incident/fight between Youth A and Youth B and Youth C at
a work site earlier that day; as well as about an incident
with Youth A throwing out her mattress due to not liking
how her bed felt.
An Employee Warning Notice for Staff 1 indicated:
• On 7/28/2025 at 8:15PM Staff 1 was the staff on shift when
a fight occurred where multiple youths were attacking
another youth; and Staff 1 could be seen moving chairs out
of the way and not using CCO’s protocol of calling the
police to ensure the youths and Staff 1’s safety.
• It was seen multiple times on video Staff 1 was not de-
escalating the youth fighting and was not seen calling the
police until after the youth was beaten in the placement,
• Due to the blatant disregard of CCO’s policies and
procedures, Staff 1 was being suspended, pending
termination following an investigation.
12

Copy of CCO’s Emergency Procedures:
• Identifies threats, gestures, physical and assaultive
behavior as an emergency.
• In the event a staff feels a youth is in immediate danger,
the staff is to send a text to all staff in the group chat
denoting a Doctor Brown code; and to proceed to step 3,
and 4 which is to call 911 and to call the immediate
supervisor to indicate a staff emergency involving a youth.
Text Message
• I reviewed a text message reported from Staff 1 that
denoted a Code Brown as indicated by Staff 1; and after
someone asked what a Code Brown is, Staff 1 responded
back typo.
Analysis The agency is found in violation as per interviews conducted,
documentation reviewed, and video footage reviewed, Staff 1 did
not demonstrate responsible character suitable for meeting the
needs of children and families served by the agency in this
incident. Staff 1 was not seen de-escalating the youth when the
youth were fighting. Also, she allowed another youth to engage in
some form of intervention with Youth A. Additionally, she did not
immediately contact the police about the youths fighting and she
did not seek immediate assistance from her co-workers or the
supervisor by contacting them or clearly reporting an emergency
or the need for help by telephone.
Technical assistance:
The agency shall encourage and instruct its staff to reframe from
using profanity, in the present of the youths (or when on
speakerphone talking to a coworker), when expressing their
emotional frustration related to stress on the job.
Conclusion Violation Established.
13

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
